alternatives.transcript: this is NBC Nightly News reported by Tom Brokaw good evening the warning on cigarettes may have to be amended after today surgeon general's report on smoking it may have to say now warning cigarettes may be even more dangerous to your health and we realized Robert Hagar tonight on the surgeon general's Grim conclusions even there the fact that smoking causes cancer has been well publicized but now the government says smoking causes even more people to die of heart attacks than have cancer

the surgeon general's annual report on smoking says that smokers run a seventy percent greater risk of a fatal heart attack than non-smokers those who smoke two or more packs a day may run a 200 to 300 percent greater risk and women who take birth control pills and smoke may run a tenfold greater risk for reasons not known the report says a smoker's risk increases according to the number of cigarettes smoked the number of years one smokes especially how young one begins and How Deeply the smoke is inhale

but the risk decreases if one quits after six years by 46% and after 10 years one's risk would be no higher than for a nonsmoker surgeongeneral Everett Koop this is an incredible assault on the health of this nation and one which we must reduce we already have seen cigarette smoking reduced in 20 years by more than one fifth that's not enough and we just have to do better in the future as for Qui cigarettes cause heart attacks it may be because nicotine makes the heart beat faster work

Carter and maybe because carbon monoxide and smoke reduces the Bloods capacity to carry oxygen to feed the hearts muscles smoke may also cause hardening of the arteries legislation for a tougher warning on cigarette packs and in ads has cleared House and Senate committees but outlook for final passage is uncertain meantime more than 55 million Americans still smoke more than a packet of half a day Robert Hagar NBC News Washington in 83 French Jets strike Targets in Lebanon some

but Greyhound rolls again and baby toes parents score a victory in court from ABC this is World News Tonight with Peter Jennings finally this was the Great American smokeout a day on which non-smokers ask their smoking friends to kick the habit at least for the day the American Cancer Society said about a third of the country's smokers did quit and the Surgeon General took advantage of the increased attention to smoking by issuing a new and more serious warning on the dangers of it

it as Bettina Gregory reports the dangers for those who still smoke are even worse than originally thought this report concludes smokers have a 70 percent greater chance of dying of heart disease than non-smokers that women who smoke and take birth control pills are 10 times more likely to have heart attacks than women who do neither and the Surgeon General warned heart disease brought on by Smoking may cause 10% of the population to die prematurely there are now 55 million

persons in America who on the average smoke more than 30 cigarettes per day this is an incredible assault on the health of this nation and one which we must reduce and there are new ways to do that like this videotape which is opposed to hypnotize smokers into quitting watch your breathing become more and more peaceful and relaxed the ancient art of acupuncture is gaining popularity acupuncturists say if a person wants to quit the needles can help it changes probably

only the chemistry of the brain and allows people to go through the withdrawal symptom ology when people stop smoking in an easier fashion whatever the means this report says smokers reduce the risk of heart disease and early death if they quit the Tina Gregory ABC News Washington
and that's our report on World News Tonight form everyone at ABC News I'm Peter Jennings goodnight

from ABC this has been worldviews tonight this is the CBS Evening News Dan Rather reporting American Cancer Society they sponsored the campaign the goal was to convince 20 million of relations 55 million smokers to go without cigarettes for 24 hours so where there's smoke there's fire this day the campaign included hotline advice from eight psychiatrist cold turkey sandwiches and an adopt a smoker program with non-smokers aiding the addicted and if all that sounds like puffery

Susan Spencer reports the Surgeon General issued a warning designed to clear the air in California actor Larry Hagman publicized the 7th annual Great American smokeout by handcuffing his secretary to his wrist to stop her smoking for 24 hours in Washington the findings of the surgeon general's report on smoking made that stunt seem a little less silly the excess mortality experience by cigarette smokers is beyond challenge up to 170

a thousand Americans will die this year of heart disease caused by smoking the report says that's almost a third of all heart disease deaths and more people than will die of cancer from smoking eventually the report says smoking-related heart disease will bring an early death to 1 in 10 Americans alive today there are now 55 million persons in America who on the average smoke more than 30 cigarettes per day this is an incredible assault on the health of this nation and one which we

reduce the report says smokers have a 70 percent greater chance of dying from heart disease than their non smoking friends as for women who overall have a lower incidence of heart disease problems the report says that's because they don't smoke as much nor inhale is deeply but women who take birth control pills and smoke run enormous risks up to 10 times more likely to have heart attacks than women who do neither and what's to be done then the Surgeon General proposed no new anti-smoking

in pain but repeated his support for stronger warnings on cigarette packs industry doesn't much like that an industry certainly didn't like this report the tobacco Institute charge that its findings were based on evidence that is not scientifically conclusive and called it a brief for the prosecution purely a media event Susan Spencer CBS News Washington
